cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move west-northwest into the east-central Gulf, then turn north-eastward making landfall along Florida’s Big Bend before accelerating northeast and emerging off the Carolina coast toward the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted as of Advisory #2
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings posted as of Advisory #2
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and Gulf Coast, then the coasts of GA, SC, NC and the Mid-Atlantic offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: Low likelihood (≈3%) of tropical-storm-force winds late Friday into Saturday; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; minor tidal fluctuations possible in upper Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain possible as the system passes offshore; totals generally 1–2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor high surf and elevated waves on Chesapeake Bay shipping channels.
